review: Trileptal (oxcarbazepine):Been on Trileptal now for about 5 years.  I have Nocturnal seizures.  Just had a breakthrough seizure during the day.  First time.  It was horrible. I fell and rolled down a sidewalk.  Was out for 45 mins.  Came to at hospital in pain from injuries.  Dr. is now adding another drug.  I hope and pray it works because I'm also losing all of my hair.  Fixing to buy a wig.

This, like every other anti seizure medication I have been prescribed caused me toxic psychosis and increased the frequency of my seizures. I can take benzodiazepines for anxiety but they don't work for controlling my seizures.

Trileptal (oxcarbazepine):This medication trileptal I have been on for over 14 years it has helped me from having seizures however now I'm getting very tired on it can't do my daily chores don't know why it's affecting me like this now

Trileptal (oxcarbazepine):I was put on this drug in the early 2000’s. I was not on it very long to know if it’d helped with my seizures or not. Because after two weeks, my hearing was not rite. Everything sounded higher pitched. And I had ringing in my ears. I was taken off the drug. My hearing returned to normal. But the constant ring in my ears never went away. It’s not as loud. But in quiet environments, I hear it.

My six year old was diagnosed in July with Epilepsy due to a  Partial Complex Seizure.  He was put on Oxcarbazepine and told to go from 2.5ml to 5 ml.  However after a month of slowly increasing we were at 4 ml twice a day when the side effects became debilitating.  Headaches, migraines, tummy aches...to the point my kid could not sit in a chair due to the pain.  We haven't had a seizure since, but not sure that is the meds since we are barely taking a partial dose 3ml which is under the threshold for my kid's weight.   I am currently talking to the doctor to find a different med because the side effects for my kid are threatening quality of life.   Additionally, my daughter HATES the taste of this medicine.

Trileptal (oxcarbazepine):I got diagnosed with Epilepsy on 7/3/15 after having 9 absence seizures in a 3 hour period. I was put on Keppra 250mg 2x/day and over the years it’s increased to 1000mg 2x/day. The seizures weren’t going away or becoming less frequent. In August 2019 I was put on Trileptal 300mg 2x/day after finding out I was also having complex partials and this pill was my miracle. I haven’t had a seizure since!

Have come across Trileptal in the last year through my 20 year journey with Epilepsy & whilst I'm still having some shifts in my seizure qualityOver this whole period of having Epilepsy all this time, the no.1 Anti-Seizure medication I found, was Keppra 1000mg twice daily. Sad part was that it had a strange way of influencing me to go & drink alcohol....Trileptal isn't so bad

Trileptal (oxcarbazepine):Taking trileptal for 5 months. Female. 450mg twice a day. No seizures but memory is now horrendous and I'm so dumb and numb. Also the 5-7% chance of having a deformed baby is not worth it but I'm stuck because all the seizures meds are horrid. Also now experiencing constipation.

the drug is effective in stopping partial seizures but it has many side effects mainly hair loss and thinning, interactions with several other drugs, interaction with female hormones (estrogen and progesterone), a small weight gain.  my 14-year-old daughter has been taking it for 4 years, the effects started after a year, and are increasing as and when.  What is the solution?

Trileptal (oxcarbazepine):My son had a head injury when he was very small and started to have seizures. Scared me so much at the time. Was told it was febrile seizures at the time. Over the past 3 years he started to have these 15 seconds tremors. We went to see a neurologist and she prescribed Trileptal for him after having a MRI and EEG which both came back normal. The medicine really does help with stopping the seizures. Because of the type of epilepsy he was diagnosed with, he will probably won't stay on the meds. But for now it's a big help. Seeing a child having seizures is so hard to watch.
